content: basic brioche h eadband by taylor rutledge needle fox arts llc for anyone wanting to learn simple two-color brioche the basic brioche headband is a wonderful place to start it s quick and warm as well as a perfect practice piece before you dive into more complicated brioche techniques using scraps of two colors in a dk weight yarn you can easily make one for everyone on your gift giving list bust your stash and gain this exciting knitting skill © taylor rutledge 2025 supplies ● 15-20 grams each of contrasting dk gauge weight yarns model shown in 7 sts & 10 row to 2 x2 5 cm x 5 cm in kelbourne scout two color brioche rib ● us6 4mm 16 cable ● tapestry needle circumference ● stitch marker approximately 21 around abbreviations co cast on mc main color cc contrast color k knit slip one stitch carrying the working yarn sl1yo across the slipped stitch brioche knit - knit the stitch with the yarnover brk as one stich brioche purl - purl the stitch with the yarnover brp as one stich brioche is a two-stitch repeat that is far simpler than it looks by working one color at a time and therefore working each round twice - once over the knits and once over the purls you create striking reversible vertical stripes with an excellent squish factor important when switching colors and the bor marker hold the just used yarn to the front and right of your project before moving the next color to the back this will prevent odd twisting if you are looking for further instruction i recommend the excellent work by michelle lee bernstein pdxknitterati and nancy marchant their video tutorials books and patterns will have you confidently brioche knitting in no time © taylor rutledge 2025 instructions loosely co 76 sts mc and join to knit in the round knit one round in mc set up round 1 with cc k1 sl1yo repeat around set up round 2 with mc sl1yo brp repeat around round 1 cc brk sl1yo repeat around round 2 mc sl1yo brp repeat around repeat these two rounds 17 more times or until your headband measures approximately 3 5 8 75 cm from the cast on edge repeat round one 1 more time ending working a cc round break the cc yarn last round mc brk k1 repeat around bind off loosely to match the gauge of the cast on weave in ends and block main color mc brp rounds contrast color cc brk round to prevent confusion i tape a scrap of each yarn here or color with a marker for easy reference © taylor rutledge 2025 a visual for understanding brioche rib we are going to start by thinking about corrugated ribbing a two colored simple rib with k1/p1 all the way around corrugated ribbing round 4 round 3 p k p k p k p k round 2 p k p k p k p k round
